lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can read and understand a text containing the units' target language.
supportStrategies: (Reading) Read the review text aloud as a class. Ask: “Can you find a [vocab/grammar point]?” Students highlight or underline examples in their books.
stretchStrategies: “Draw and Check” Dictation – Read 4–6 short sentences using target language (e.g., “There’s a red car under the bed.”). Students draw each scene. Afterwards, show or read again so they can self-check and explain what they heard.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can listen and identify the units' target language correctly.
supportStrategies: (Listening) Say or play short sentences using target language from previous units. Students point, circle, or hold up the matching item or image.
stretchStrategies: “Draw and Check” Dictation – Read 4–6 short sentences using target language (e.g., “There’s a red car under the bed.”). Students draw each scene. Afterwards, show or read again so they can self-check and explain what they heard.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can reflect on their learning across the units and say what they can do.
supportStrategies: (Reflection) Write prompts: “I can name…,” “I can say…,” “I can ask…” Students complete with language they remember using speech bubbles or drawings.
stretchStrategies: “Draw and Check” Dictation – Read 4–6 short sentences using target language (e.g., “There’s a red car under the bed.”). Students draw each scene. Afterwards, show or read again so they can self-check and explain what they heard.
